section.title: Description
section.p: This class captures pertinent information of women's health case summarization of a patient for an assigned caseManager.

stentry.p: Indicates whether the patient or the one of the patient's relatives have had breast cancer. Possible values include: No family history, 2nd degree relative, 1st degree relative, 3: More than one 1st degree relatives, Personal history, or Unknown.
Identifies the current or next breast procedure or treatment recommended for this patient.
The date when the current or next breast procedure or treatment should be completed.
Identifies the current or next cervical procedure or treatment recommended for this patient.
The date when the current or next cervical procedure or treatment should be completed.
An indication of whether the patient was exposed to diethylstilbestrol (DES) in utero. Possible values include: Yes, No, or Unknown.
An archaic term for the estimated date a baby might be born. It is determined based on the first day of a woman's last menstruation. See Naegele's rule.
Indicates whether the patient has experienced any sexual trauma (rape, sexual assault, etc.) as a civilian. Possible values include: Yes, No, Declined to answer, Unknown.
Uniquely identifies the summary of the patient's Women's Health record.
Indicates whether the patient is currently pregnant.
Identifies the current Pap regimen for the patient.
The date on which the patient began or will begin her current PAP regimen.
Identifies the patient associated with the procedure, notification and/or refusal.
Indicates the procedure refused by the patient.
Indicates the notification to the patient from the case manager.
